definitions.definition: Form of a word with a stronger or more forceful sense than the root on which the intensive is built.
Thorough; to a great degree; with intensity.
Demanding; requiring a great amount of work etc.
definitions.example: This job is difficult because it is so labour-intensive.
I took a three-day intensive course in finance.

definitions.definition: Stretched; allowing intension, or increase of degree; that can be intensified.
(grammar) Serving to give force or emphasis.
Related to the need to manage life-threatening conditions by means of sophisticated life support and monitoring.
definitions.example: She was moved to the intensive-care unit of the hospital.
